{{pp-vandalism|small=yes}} {{Infobox person | name = Lil Pump | image = File:Lil Pump mugshot.jpg | caption = Lil Pump in 2018 | birth_name = Gazzy Garcia | birth_date = {{birth date and age|2000|8|17}}<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.xxlmag.com/news/2018/08/happy-birthday-lil-pump/|title=Happy Birthday, Lil Pump! - XXL|work=XXL Mag|access-date=2018-11-07|language=en}}</ref> | birth_place = | residence = [[Calabasas]], [[California]], U.S.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Burford |first1=Corinna |title=Lil Pump Calabasas evacuation |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/8484261/lil-pump-evacuates-calabasas-home |access-date=November 23, 2018 |publisher=Vulture |date=November 9, 2018}}</ref> | occupation = {{flatlist| * Rapper * singer * songwriter * record producer }} | years_active = 2016–present | home_town = [[Miami]], [[Florida]], U.S.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Burford |first1=Corinna |title=Your Cheat Sheet for Telling All the SoundCloud Rappers Apart |url=http://www.vulture.com/2018/04/2018-soundcloud-rappers-guide.html |accessdate=September 30, 2018 |publisher=Vulture |date=April 4, 2018}}</ref> | awards = | module = {{Infobox musical artist <!-- See WP:WikiProject Musicians -->|embed=yes | background = solo_singer | instrument = Vocals | genre = {{flatlist| * [[Hip hop music|Hip hop]] * [[SoundCloud rap]]<ref name=xxlmagalbum>{{cite web|url=http://www.xxlmag.com/rap-music/reviews/2017/10/lil-pump-album-review/|access-date=2018-06-16|language=en-US|title=Lil Pump Levels Up With Self-Titled Debut Album|website=XXL Mag|date=October 2017|quote=Lil Pump is a project that confirms its creator's arrival and his place as one of the leading men in the SoundCloud rap scene.}}</ref> * [[Trap music|trap]] }} <!-- do not change without consensus --> | label = {{flatlist| * Tha Lights Global * [[Warner Bros. Records|Warner Bros.]] }} | associated_acts = {{flatlist| * [[Kanye West]] * [[Lil Yachty]] * [[Smokepurpp]]<ref name="XXL2">{{cite web |url=http://hiphopdx.com/news/id.39179/title.lil-yachty-announces-signing-to-quality-control |title=Lil Yachty Promises He's Dropping A Tape with Lil Pump|last=Berry |first=Peter A. |date=November 10, 2017|website=XXL.com |access-date=1 January 2018}}</ref> }} | website = {{URL|unhappy.com}} }} }}
'''Gazzy Garcia''' (born August 17, 2000), known professionally as '''Lil Pump''', is an American rapper, singer, songwriter, and record producer.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://pigeonsandplanes.com/news/2018/02/lil-pump-previews-self-produced-song-making-beats |title=Lil Pump Is Making Beats Now |work=PigeonsandPlanes |access-date=2018-02-15 |language=en}}</ref> He is best known for his 2017 song "[[Gucci Gang]]", which peaked at number three on the U.S. [[Billboard (magazine)|''Billboard'']] [[Billboard Hot 100|Hot 100]], and is [[Recording Industry Association of America certification|certified triple platinum]] by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]].<ref name=platinum>{{cite web |title=Gucci Gang |url=https://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/?tab_active=default-award&ar=&ti=gucci+gang&lab=&genre=&format=&date_option=release&from=&to=&award=&type=&category=&adv=SEARCH#search_section |publisher=Recording Industry Association of America |accessdate=September 28, 2018}}</ref> His other songs include "[[I Love It (Kanye West and Lil Pump song)|I Love It]]" (with [[Kanye West]]), "[[Boss (Lil Pump song)|Boss]]", "[[Esskeetit]]", and "[[Drug Addicts (song)|Drug Addicts]]".<ref name="Hot100">{{cite web |url=http://www.billboard.com/music/lil-pump/chart-history |title=Lil Pump – Chart History: Billboard Hot 100 |work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |accessdate=October 30, 2017}}</ref> He released his debut studio album, ''[[Lil Pump (album)|Lil Pump]]'', on October 6, 2017.
==Early life== Gazzy Garcia was born August 17, 2000 in [[Miami|Miami, Florida]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/lil-pump-mn0003626782/biography|title=Lil Pump {{!}} Biography & History {{!}} AllMusic|website=AllMusic|access-date=2018-11-07}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.xxlmag.com/news/2018/08/happy-birthday-lil-pump/|title=Happy Birthday, Lil Pump! - XXL|work=XXL Mag|access-date=2018-11-07|language=en}}</ref> In a 2018 interview with [[J. Cole]], he stated that both of his parents are from [[Colombia]] and that they divorced when he was six years old. He also mentions having an older half-brother.<ref>{{cite news |author1=Aron A. |title=J. Cole & Lil Pump Full Interview With Each Other Has Arrived |url=https://www.hotnewhiphop.com/j-cole-and-lil-pump-full-interview-with-each-other-has-arrived-news.51076.html |accessdate=November 2, 2018 |publisher=Hot New Hip Hop |date=May 25, 2018}}</ref>
When he was thirteen years old, his cousin, Lil Ominous, introduced him to Omar Pineiro, better known as [[Smokepurpp]]; the two eventually became collaborators. Garcia and Piniero were expelled from multiple district schools. Garcia, thereafter, enrolled in an [[Opportunity school|opportunity high school]] but was expelled in the tenth grade for fighting and inciting a riot.<ref>{{Citation|first=Cole |last=Bennett|title=Smokepurpp & Lil Pump: The Lyrical Lemonade Interview|date=September 18, 2016|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aDq88uhypL4&t=12s|accessdate=December 30, 2017 |via=[[YouTube]]}}</ref>
==Career== ===Career beginnings (2016)=== Lil Pump's rap career began when Smokepurpp produced a track and asked him to freestyle over it. The single produced was independently released in 2016 on the music streaming website [[SoundCloud]], as his debut single, "Lil Pump".<ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/features/look-at-me-the-noisy-soundcloud-revolution-changing-rap-w485101|title=Look At Me!: The Noisy, Blown-Out SoundCloud Revolution Redefining Rap|work=Rolling Stone|accessdate=October 10, 2017|date=June 1, 2017|first=David|last=Turner}}</ref> Lil Pump quickly followed the song with singles "Elementary", "Ignorant", "Gang Shit", and "Drum$tick", each possessing over three million streams.<ref name="soundcloud.com">{{cite web|url=https://soundcloud.com/wavey-hefner/tracks|title=Lil Pump's Soundcloud profile|publisher=SoundCloud|accessdate=November 19, 2017}}</ref> The success of his tracks on SoundCloud earned him recognition among the [[South Florida]] [[underground rap]] scene, in a style known as "[[SoundCloud rap]]". He co-headlined the No Jumper tour in 2016, and also performed at the Rolling Loud Festival.<ref name="HNHH">{{cite web|url=http://www.hotnewhiphop.com/everything-you-need-to-know-about-lil-pump-news.31687.html?|title=Everything You Need To Know About Lil Pump|last=Schwartz|first=Danny|date=April 26, 2017|accessdate=July 15, 2017|publisher=[[HotNewHipHop]]}}</ref><ref name="XXLChief">{{cite news|url=http://www.xxlmag.com/news/2017/05/chief-keef-lil-pump-hit-the-studio/|title=Chief Keef and Lil Pump Hit the Studio|last=Berry|first=Peter A.|date=May 18, 2017|accessdate=July 15, 2017|publisher=[[XXL (magazine)|XXL Mag]]}}</ref>
===Rising popularity and ''Lil Pump'' (2017)=== Lil Pump began 2017 by releasing the singles "D Rose" and "[[Boss (Lil Pump song)|Boss]]", which were major hits on SoundCloud, collecting a combined 70 million streams.<ref name="soundcloud.com"/> The popularity of "D Rose" led to a [[music video]] being produced by Chicago based director Cole Bennett, also known as Lyrical Lemonade. The music video was released on [[YouTube]] on January 30, 2017, and has gained 145 million views as of July 2018.<ref>{{Citation|first=Cole|last=Bennett|title=Lil Pump – D Rose (Shot by @_ColeBennett_)|date=January 30, 2017|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6Prfg3vyZkA|accessdate=October 10, 2017|via=[[YouTube]]}}</ref> On June 9, 2017, Lil Pump signed a record deal with Tha Lights Global and [[Warner Bros. Records]], just two months before his seventeenth birthday.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hotnewhiphop.com/lil-pump-signs-to-warner-bros-records-news.33541.html|title=Lil Pump Signs To Warner Bros Records Imprint Tha Lights Global|publisher=[[HotNewHipHop]]|date=June 9, 2017|first=Danny|last=Schwartz|accessdate=November 19, 2017}}</ref> However, in January 2018, his contract with Warner Bros. Records was voided because he had been a minor at the time of signing.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/hip-hop/8094047/lil-pump-free-agent-contract-voided-warner-bros|title=Lil Pump Now Free Agent, Contract Voided With Warner Bros.|work=Billboard|date=November 1, 2018|first=Colin|last=Stutz|accessdate=February 15, 2018}}</ref>
In July 2017, Lil Pump announced through [[Twitter]] that his debut album was in the works and would be released in August.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.xxlmag.com/news/2017/07/lil-pump-announces-debut-project-dropping-august/|title=Lil Pump Announces Debut Project Dropping in August - XXL|website=XXL Mag|accessdate=19 November 2017}}</ref> Although the album was not released in August it was pushed back and he instead released the song "[[Gucci Gang]]", which became his first ''Billboard'' Hot 100 entry, peaking at number three on November 8, 2017.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.xxlmag.com/news/2017/09/lil-pump-billboard-hot-100-chart/|title=Lil Pump Lands His First Song on the Billboard Hot 100 Chart – XXL|website=XXL Mag|language=en-US|access-date=2017-10-10}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/video/early-release-billboard-hot-100-top-10-november-18th-2017-countdown-official-8023256|title=Early Release! Billboard Hot 100 Top 10 November 18th 2017 Countdown – Official|publisher=|accessdate=19 November 2017}}</ref><ref name="Hot100"/> The song was [[Recording Industry Association of America certification|certified gold and platinum]] by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] on January 11, 2018 and as of July 31, 2018 is certified triple platinum.<ref name=platinum/>
On October 6, 2017, he released his debut commercial [[studio album]], ''[[Lil Pump (album)|Lil Pump]]'', featuring [[Smokepurpp]], [[Gucci Mane]], [[Lil Yachty]], [[Chief Keef]], [[Rick Ross]], and [[2 Chainz]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.xxlmag.com/news/2017/10/listen-lil-pump-debut-album/|title=Listen to Lil Pump's Self-Titled Debut Album – XXL|website=XXL Mag|language=en-US|access-date=2017-10-10}}</ref>
===''Harverd Dropout'' (2018–)=== Lil Pump released "[[I Shyne]]" on January 18, 2018 with producer [[Carnage (DJ)|Carnage]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://pigeonsandplanes.com/music/2018/01/lil-pump-carnage-i-shyne|title=Lil Pump Connects With Carnage for Wild New Song "i Shyne"|work=PigeonsandPlanes|access-date=2018-02-15|language=en}}</ref> Following reports that he had left his former label [[Warner Bros. Records]] and the contract had been voided on the grounds of him being a minor when he signed,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.xxlmag.com/news/2018/01/lil-pump-out-of-warner-bros-deal/|title=Lil Pump's Warner Bros. Records Contract Voided - XXL|website=XXL Mag|access-date=2018-02-15}}</ref> competition rose to sign Lil Pump with offers reportedly as high as $8 million<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://variety.com/2018/music/news/lil-pumps-warner-bros-contract-voided-gucci-gang-rapper-is-entertaining-other-offers-1202662829/|title=Lil Pump's Warner Bros. Contract Voided, 'Gucci Gang' Rapper Is Entertaining Other Offers|last=Aswad|first=Jem|date=2018-01-12|work=Variety|access-date=2018-02-15|language=en-US}}</ref> to $12 million or more,<ref>{{cite news|title=It's Official: 'Gucci Gang' Rapper Lil Pump Re-Signs With Warner Bros. Records|url=https://variety.com/2018/music/news/lil-pump-gucci-gang-rapper-record-contract-warner-bros-records-1202722117/|accessdate=March 14, 2018|work=Variety|date=March 13, 2018}}</ref> and artists such as [[Gucci Mane]] and [[DJ Khaled]] taking interest in him.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/hip-hop/8094724/gucci-mane-lil-pump-1017-records-instagram-comment|title=Gucci Mane Wants to Sign Lil Pump: 'U Name the Price'|work=Billboard|access-date=2018-02-15}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.xxlmag.com/news/2018/01/dj-khaled-sign-lil-pump-we-the-best-music/|title=DJ Khaled Wants to Sign Lil Pump to We the Best Music – XXL|website=XXL Mag|access-date=2018-02-15}}</ref> Lil Pump sparked rumors he had signed with Gucci Mane's imprint, [[1017 Records]], in February 2018.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://hiphop-n-more.com/2018/02/breakout-rapper-lil-pump-signs-with-gucci-manes-1017-label/|title=Breakout Rapper Lil Pump Signs With Gucci Mane's 1017 Label|date=2018-02-10|work=HipHop-N-More|access-date=2018-02-15|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.xxlmag.com/news/2018/02/lil-pump-rumors-he-signed-gucci-manes-1017-eskimo-records/|title=Lil Pump Sparks Rumors He Signed to Gucci Mane’s Label – XXL|website=XXL Mag|access-date=2018-02-15}}</ref> Nonetheless, he re-signed another contract with [[Warner Bros. Records|Warner Bros.]] for $8 million on March 12, 2018.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://variety.com/2018/music/news/lil-pump-gucci-gang-rapper-record-contract-warner-bros-records-1202722117/|title=Lil Pump Warner Bros. deal|last=|first=|date=|website=Variety|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
On April 13, 2018, Lil Pump released "[[Esskeetit]]", which debuted and peaked at number 24 on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100.<ref name="Hot100" /> In July 2018, he released the single "[[Drug Addicts (song)|Drug Addicts]]" alongside a music video which features [[Charlie Sheen]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.nme.com/news/charlie-sheen-appears-in-lil-pumps-latest-video-2350641 |title=Charlie Sheen appears in Lil Pump's latest video |date=2018-07-05 |website=NME |language=en-US |access-date=2018-07-06}}</ref>
On September 7, 2018, Lil Pump collaborated with [[Kanye West]] and comedian [[Adele Givens]] for the track "[[I Love It (Kanye West and Lil Pump song)|I Love It]]".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.complex.com/music/2018/09/kanye-west-lil-pump-i-love-it-video-memes |title=Kanye and Lil Pump's "I Love It" Video Gets the Memes It Was Made to Inspire |first=Joshua |last=Espinoza |date=September 7, 2018 |accessdate=September 8, 2018 |work=Complex}}</ref> The track went straight to number 1 on the [[Canadian Hot 100]].<ref>{{cite web |title=The week of September 22, 2018 |url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/canadian-hot-100/2018-09-22 |publisher=''Billboard'' |accessdate=September 28, 2018}}</ref>
Lil Pump announced in August 2018 a tour to promote his upcoming album ''[[Harverd Dropout]]'', but it was cancelled a month later due to "unforeseen circumstances".<ref>{{cite news |last1=Lamarre |first1=Carl |title=Lil Pump Announces Harverd Dropout Tour |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/hip-hop/8469997/lil-pump-announces-harverd-dropout-tour-dates |accessdate=September 30, 2018 |work=Billboard |date=August 14, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Aubrey |first1=Elizabeth |title=Lil Pump cancels his upcoming tour following legal issues |url=https://www.nme.com/news/music/lil-pump-cancels-upcoming-tour-amid-legal-issues-2384898|accessdate=September 30, 2018 |work=NME |date=September 30, 2018}}</ref> On October 5, 2018, he released "[[Multi Millionaire (song)|Multi Millionaire]]" as a single featuring [[Lil Uzi Vert]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/lil-pump-lil-uzi-vert-multi-millionaire-732828/ |title=Hear Lil Pump, Lil Uzi Vert Collide on Blistering ‘Multi Millionaire’ |last=Leight |first=Elias |date=2018-10-05 |website=Rolling Stone |language=en-US |access-date=2018-10-13}}</ref>
On October 25, 2018, EDM DJ-producer [[Skrillex]] released the song "[[Arms Around You]]", which is a collaboration he made with Lil Pump, [[XXXTentacion]], [[Maluma (singer)|Maluma]] and [[Swae Lee]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nme.com/news/music/skrillex-teases-new-track-xxxtentacion-lil-pump-2393317|title=Skrillex shares new collaborative track ‘Arms Around You’ with XXXTentacion, Lil Pump and more |work=NME |last=Daly |first=Rhian |date=October 25, 2018|accessdate=October 25, 2018}}</ref>
==Legal issues== On February 15, 2018, Lil Pump was arrested for discharging a weapon in an inhabited place.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.complex.com/music/2018/02/lil-pump-arrested-for-firing-weapon|title=Lil Pump Arrested for Firing Weapon at Home|website=Complex|language=en|access-date=2018-02-15}}</ref> According to his manager, three men attempted to break into his home in San Fernando Valley at around 4 pm before shooting into the door. Police found the bullet may have come from inside the home, coming back later with a search warrant before finding an unloaded handgun below the balcony with ammunition elsewhere in the residence.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.hotnewhiphop.com/lil-pump-reportedly-arrested-for-firing-gun-in-his-home-news.43898.html|title=Lil Pump Reportedly Arrested For Firing Gun In His Home|work=HotNewHipHop|access-date=2018-02-15}}</ref> Lil Pump's mother was subsequently investigated for endangering a minor and having an unsecured firearm at the home.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://uproxx.com/hiphop/lil-pump-arrested-for-shooting-gun-in-his-home/|title=Lil Pump Has Been Arrested For Firing A Gun Inside His Home|date=2018-02-15|work=UPROXX|access-date=2018-02-15|language=en-US}}</ref>
On August 29, 2018, Lil Pump was arrested for driving without a license in Miami.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.local10.com/news/local/miami/rapper-lil-pump-arrested-for-driving-without-licence-miami-police-say|title=Rapper Lil Pump arrested for driving without license, Miami...|last=Swift|first=Tim|website=www.local10.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-09-04}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.complex.com/music/2018/08/lil-pump-lawyer-says-rappers-arrest-was-due-to-profiling|title=Lil Pump's Lawyer Says the Rapper's Arrest Was Due to Racial Profiling|website=Complex|language=en|access-date=2018-08-31}}</ref> On September 3 he announced that he would be going to jail for 'a few months' for a parole violation stemming from the arrest.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/hip-hop/8473297/lil-pump-tells-fans-hes-going-to-jail-for-a-couple-months-after|title=Lil Pump Tells Fans He's Going to Jail for a 'Couple Months' After Violating Probation: Watch|work=Billboard|access-date=2018-09-04}}</ref> However, he appeared on the live American television show ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' on September 29.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.xxlmag.com/news/2018/09/lil-pumps-saturday-night-live-performance-proves-hes-not-in-jail/|title=Lil Pump’s ’SNL' Performance Proves He’s Not in Jail - XXL|work=XXL Mag|access-date=2018-09-30|language=en}}</ref> Lil Pump's manager told [[Billboard (magazine)|''Billboard'']] in October 2018 that the rapper had served a prison sentence, but did not give any further details.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Lockett |first1=Dee |title=21 Under 21: Lil Pump on Recording 'I Love It' With Kanye West and Breaking Through the SoundCloud Noise |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/grammys/8479042/lil-pump-kanye-west-21-under-21-interview |accessdate=October 12, 2018 |work=Billboard |date=October 10, 2018}}</ref>
==Discography== {{main|Lil Pump discography}} * ''[[Lil Pump (album)|Lil Pump]]'' (2017) * ''[[Harverd Dropout]]'' (2018)
==Awards and nominations== {| class="wikitable" ! Year !! Award !! Category !! Nominated work !! Result !! Ref. |- | rowspan="2"|2018 |[[2018 Billboard Music Awards|Billboard Music Awards]] | Top Streaming Song | "[[Gucci Gang]]" | rowspan="2" {{nom}} | <ref>{{cite news |last1=Coleman |first1=C. Vernon II |title=2018 Billboard Music Awards Winners List |url=http://www.xxlmag.com/news/2018/05/2018-billboard-music-awards-winners-list/ |accessdate=September 28, 2018 |work=XXL |date=May 20, 2018}}</ref> |- | [[2018 MTV Video Music Awards|MTV Video Music Awards]] | Push Artist of The Year | Lil Pump |<ref>{{cite news |title=VMAs 2018: The winners' list |url=https://eu.usatoday.com/story/life/music/2018/08/20/mtv-vmas-2018-winners-list/1048301002/ |accessdate=September 28, 2018 |work=USA Today |date=August 21, 2018}}</ref> |- |}

page.title: List of people from Peterborough, Ontario

revision.text:
[[Peterborough, Ontario|Peterborough]] and its surrounding area is and has been home to many notable people, especially considering its relatively small size. It has been especially prolific in producing players for the [[National Hockey League|NHL]] through the [[Peterborough Petes]]. It also has produced a number of musicians, actors and authors.
==Actors== *[[Matt Frewer]], aka 1980s icon "Max Headroom" *[[Barclay Hope]], actor *[[William Hope (actor)|William Hope]], actor *[[David Kaye (voice actor)|David Kaye]], voice actor *[[Estella Warren]], former synchronized swimmer; model and actress *[[Ben_Hollingsworth_(actor)|Ben Hollingsworth]], actor
==Athletes== *[[Les Ascott]], (d. 2013) former CFL player with the [[Toronto Argonauts]] *[[Zac Bierk]], former professional hockey player and brother of Sebastian Bach *[[Scotty Bowman]], former hockey coach, [[Detroit Red Wings]], [[Montreal Canadiens]] *[[Steve Chiasson]], (1967–1999) [[National Hockey League]] player *[[John Druce]], former NHL player with Washington Capitals, Winnipeg Jets, Los Angeles Kings and Philadelphia Flyers *[[Vince Dunn]], NHL player with the [[St. Louis Blues]] *[[Mike Fisher (ice hockey)|Mike Fisher]], NHL player with the [[Nashville Predators]]; husband of [[Carrie Underwood]] *[[Bob Gainey]], former NHL player and now General Manager with the Montreal Canadiens *[[Rex Harrington]], ballet dancer *[[Mike Keenan]], former NHL coach with the [[Calgary Flames]] *[[Steve Larmer]], former NHL player with the [[Chicago Blackhawks]] and [[New York Rangers]] *[[Rick McCrank]], professional skateboarder *[[Greg Millen]], [[hockey]] analyst, goaltender for the NHL *[[Roger Neilson]], (1934–2003) innovative NHL coach who spent ten years coaching the Peterborough Petes *[[Corey Perry]], NHL player with the [[Anaheim Ducks]] *[[Bobby Roode]], professional wrestler working for [[WWE]] *[[Marc Savard]], professional hockey player *[[Cory Stillman]], former NHL player with the [[Florida Panthers]] *[[Jesse Young]], professional basketball player with [[MMT Estudiantes]] in the Spanish [[Liga ACB]]
==Musicians== *[[Adam Gontier]], singer, songwriter and guitarist of [[Three Days Grace]] *[[Emily Haines]], musician, lead singer of [[Metric (band)|Metric]] *[[Ronnie Hawkins]], rock musician, currently resides in Lakefield (Peterborough County) *[[Ramin Karimloo]], singer, songwriter, West End/Broadway performer *[[Trevor McNevan]], lead singer of rock band [[Thousand Foot Krutch]] *[[Serena Ryder]], singer and songwriter *[[Sebastian Bach]], lead singer of rock band Skid Row *[[Neil Sanderson]], drummer of Three Days Grace *[[Christian Tanna]], brother of Jagori Tanna; co-founder of the band [[I Mother Earth]] *[[Jagori Tanna]], brother of Christian Tanna; co-founder of the band I Mother Earth *[[Greg Wells]], songwriter and record producer *[[Rob Wells]], songwriter and record producer *[[Royal Wood]], singer, songwriter
==Politicians== *[[George Albertus Cox]], (1840–1914), former mayor, Canadian Senator *[[Dean Del Mastro]] *[[Gerard Kennedy]], 2006 Liberal leadership candidate, studied at [[Trent University]] *[[Lester B. Pearson]], former Prime Minister of [[Canada]]
==Religion== *[[Alden John Bell]], Roman Catholic bishop
==Writers== *[[Dave Carley]], playwright *[[Robertson Davies]], (1913–1995), novelist, playwright, critic, journalist and professor *[[Hugh Kenner]], scholar of [[Modernism|modernist]] literature *[[Yann Martel]], winner of the [[Booker Prize]], studied philosophy at Peterborough's [[Trent University]] *[[Paul Nicholas Mason]], author of ''Battered Soles'', ''The Red Dress'' and ''The Discipline Committee'' *[[Derek McCormack (writer)|Derek McCormack]], writer *[[Leah McLaren]], journalist, author *[[Susanna Moodie]], 19th-century author *[[Ian Rogers (writer)|Ian Rogers]], horror writer *[[Catherine Parr Traill]], 19th-century author *[[Peter Wray]], filmmaker, writer and marketing strategist
==Other== *[[Jim Balsillie]], co-[[CEO]] of [[Research In Motion]] *Dr. [[Roberta Bondar]], chancellor of [[Trent University]]; first Canadian woman in space *[[Seán Cullen]], comedian, radio personality *[[Peter Demos]], [[MIT]] physicist, former director of [[Massachusetts Institute of Technology School of Science#Bates Linear Accelerator|Bates Linear Accelerator]] *[[Sandford Fleming]], (1827–1915) engineer, inventor; invented Standard Time *[[Jeffrey Karp]], researcher in bioengineering *[[Henry Rowe Hocking Kenner|Dr. Henry Rowe Hocking Kenner, B.A., LL.D.]] (1867–1944), educator and principal *[[Trevor Kincaid]], zoologist at the [[University of Washington]] *[[John D. Lowry]], film restoration expert *[[Thomas Symons]], founding President of Trent University {{Peterborough, Ontario}} {{People of Canada}} {{Ontario topic}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:List Of People From Peterborough, Ontario}} [[Category:People from Peterborough, Ontario|*]] [[Category:Lists of people by city or town in Canada|Peterborough]] [[Category:Lists of people by place]] [[Category:Lists of people from Ontario]]

page.title: List of people with diabetes mellitus type 1

revision.text:
{{Dynamic list}} '''[[Diabetes mellitus type 1]]''', also known as type 1 diabetes, or T1DM (formerly known as insulin-dependent diabetes or juvenile diabetes) is a condition in which the body does not produce [[insulin]], resulting in [[hyperglycemia|high levels of sugar in the bloodstream]].<ref name=NIH2014Cau/><ref name=NIH2014Type>{{cite web|title=Types of Diabetes|url=https://www.niddk.nih.gov/health-information/diabetes/types|website=NIDDK|accessdate=31 July 2016|date=February 2014|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160816162556/https://www.niddk.nih.gov/health-information/diabetes/types|archivedate=16 August 2016|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Whereas [[Diabetes mellitus type 2|type 2 diabetes]] is typically diagnosed in middle age and treated via diet, oral medication and/or insulin therapy, type 1 diabetes tends to be diagnosed earlier in life, and people with type 1 diabetes require [[insulin (medication)|insulin therapy]] for survival.<ref name=NIH2014Cau>{{cite web|title=Causes of Diabetes|url=https://www.niddk.nih.gov/health-information/diabetes/causes|website=NIDDK|accessdate=July 31, 2016|date=August 2014|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160810063435/https://www.niddk.nih.gov/health-information/diabetes/causes|archivedate = August 10, 2016|df=dmy-all}}</ref> It is significantly less common than type 2 diabetes, accounting for 5 percent of all diabetes diagnoses.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.webmd.com/diabetes/type-1-diabetes|work=WebMD|title=Type 1 Diabetes|accessdate=28 March 2018}}</ref>
This '''list of notable people with diabetes mellitus type 1''' includes writers, artists, athletes, entertainers, and others who have been documented as having type 1 diabetes. <!-- ==== ==== | 1) This list is subject to the policies of Wikipedia's Biographies of Living People. | | 2) New additions without reliable citations such as printed sources WILL be removed. | | 3) Personal sites and blogs are not reliable sources, as they are self-published. | | 4) If your addition meets the above criteria, add the person above alphabetically. | | 5) ALL additions must have a Wikipedia article; do NOT add individuals who do not. | ======== ======== --> ==List of people== [[File:Nickboynton.jpg|thumb|right|upright=.75|[[Nick Boynton]]]] [[File:Damon Dash by David Shankbone.jpg|thumb|upright=.75|right|[[Damon Dash]]]] [[File:14-06-09 RiP Haim Este Haim 2.JPG|thumb|upright=.75|right|[[Haim (band)|Este Haim]]]] [[File:Nick Jonas Bluesfest Ottawa Canada 2011 (2).jpg|thumb|right|upright=.75|[[Nick Jonas]]]] [[File:Jerry Lewis Cannes 2013 2.jpg|thumb|right|upright=.75|[[Jerry Lewis]]]] [[File:Theresa May portrait.jpg|thumb|right|upright=.75|[[Theresa May]]]] [[File:Mary Tyler Moore Dick Van Dyke Dick Van Dyke Show 1961(crop).jpg|thumb|right|upright=.75|[[Mary Tyler Moore]]]] [[File:Sam Reid (GWS) 2017.jpg|thumb|right|upright=.75|[[Sam Reid (footballer, born 1989)|Sam Reid]]]] [[File:Anne Rice.jpg|thumb|right|upright=.75|[[Anne Rice]]]] [[File:Sonia Sotomayor in SCOTUS robe.jpg|thumb|right|upright=.75|[[Sonia Sotomayor]]]] {| class="wikitable sortable" style=width:70% |- ! style="width:20%;"| Name ! This is a list of amateur and professional explorers of the oceans, including [[Archaeologist]]s, [[Treasure hunters]], [[Biologist]]s, [[Marine Geologist]]s, [[Geophysicist]]s, Ocean Engineers, [[Oceanographer]]s, Submersible Designers, Pilots of Submersibles, [[Cave diving|Cave Divers]], [[Caver]]s, and [[Speleologist]]s, and First Generation [[Diving safety officer|Diving Safety Officer]]s.
== Archaeologists and treasure hunters == [[File:Spence with gold sword handle.jpg|right|thumb|[[E. Lee Spence]], noted pioneer underwater archaeologist, author, editor, and discoverer of the ''[[H. L. Hunley (submarine)|Hunley]]''.]] :'''Marine archaeologists''' (also known as '''maritime archaeologists''') are persons working in the discipline of [[Marine Archaeology]] (also known as '''[[maritime archaeology]]''') and study human interaction with the [[sea]], lakes and rivers through the study of vessels, shore side facilities, cargoes, human remains and submerged landscapes. One speciality is [[underwater archaeology]], which studies the past through any submerged remains. Another specialty within maritime archaeology is [[nautical]] archaeology, which studies vessel construction and use.
:'''[[Treasure hunters]]''' sell the [[Artifact (archaeology)|artifacts]] (cannons, bottles, coins, specie, bullion - also known as '''treasure''') they find on [[shipwrecks]] and, when proficient at archaeology and working within the law, they are the capitalists of marine archaeology. Treasure hunters without proficiency in archaeology and salvaging historical artifacts without government permits are looters.<ref>[http://www.shipwrecks.com/ethics_in_underwater_archaeology.htm Ethics in Underwater Archaeology (Capitalism versus Socialism in Underwater Archaeology) by E. Lee Spence]</ref>
* [[Robert Ballard]] (born 1942), underwater archaeologist, professor at [[University of Rhode Island]] * [[George F. Bass]] (born 1932), pioneer underwater archaeologist, author, founded [[Institute of Nautical Archaeology]] in 1973 * [[Mel Fisher]] * [[Robert F. Marx]] (born 1933), pioneer underwater archaeologist, prolific author * [[John Mattera]] ( born 1962), author and discoverer of the Pirate Ship of Joseph Bannister, and the Golden Fleece * [[John Chatterton]] (born 1954), co-discoverer of the Pirate Ship of Joseph Bannsister Golden Fleece * [[Mark M. Newell]], founder of Georgia Archaeological Institute * [[William R. Royal]] (March 16, 1905–May 8, 1997), explorer of [[Warm Mineral Springs]] and [[Little Salt Spring]] in [[Florida]] * [[E. Lee Spence]] (born 1947), pioneer underwater archaeologist and treasure hunter, prolific author of books, maps and articles on shipwrecks, editor, a founder of [[Sea Research Society]] in 1972 * [[Robert Sténuit]] (born 1933), underwater archeologist and the world's first [[aquanaut]] * [[Peter Throckmorton]] (died 1990), pioneer underwater archaeologist, director [[Sea Research Society]]
== Biologists == [[File:Jacques-Yves Cousteau.jpg|right|thumb|Jacques-Yves Cousteau, co-inventor of the [[aqua-lung]], is well known for popularizing marine biology.]] :'''[[Marine biology]]''', or '''Biological oceanography''' is the study of the plants, animals and microbes ([[biota (ecology)|biota]]) of the oceans and their [[ecology|ecological]] interaction. * [[Ali Abdelghany]] (born 1944), [[Egypt]]ian marine biologist * [[Adolf Appellöf|Jakob Johan Adolf Appellöf]] (1857–1921), [[Sweden|Swedish]] marine zoologist. * [[Samuel Stillman Berry]] (1887–1984), U.S. marine zoologist. * [[Henry Bryant Bigelow]] (1879–1967), U.S. marine biologist. * [[Rachel Carson]] (1907–1964), American Marine Biologist and Author. * [[Carl Chun]] (1852–1914), [[Germany|German]] marine biologist * [[Jacques-Yves Cousteau]] (1910–1997), [[France|French]] marine biologist and explorer * [[Charles Darwin]] (1809–1882), wrote ''Structure and Distribution of Coral Reefs'' (1842) while aboard the [[HMS Beagle]] *[[Anton Dohrn]] (1840–1909), German marine biologist * [[Sylvia Earle]] (born 1935), American oceanographer * [[Hans Hass]] (born 1919), Austrian marine biologist and diving pioneer * [[Gotthilf Hempel]] (born 1929), German marine biologist * [[Johan Hjort]] (1869–1948), Norwegian marine zoologist and one of the founders of [[International Council for the Exploration of the Sea|ICES]] * [[Bruno Hofer]] (1861–1916), German fisheries scientist * [[Hirohito|Emperor Showa of Japan]] (1901–1989), [[jellyfish]] [[Taxonomy (biology)|taxonomist]] * [[Uwe Kils]] (born 1951), German marine biologist * [[August David Krohn]] (1803–1891), Russian/German zoologist * [[William Elford Leach]] (1790–1836), [[England|English]] zoologist and marine biologist * [[Nicholai Miklukho-Maklai]] (1846–1888), [[Russia]]n marine biologist and anthropologist * [[John Murray (oceanographer)|Sir John Murray]] (1841–1914), [[Scotland|Scots]]–[[Canada|Canadian]] marine biologist * [[Wheeler J. North]] (1922–2002), American marine biologist and diving pioneer * [[Ed Ricketts]] (1897–1948), American marine biologist noted for a pioneering study of intertidal ecology * [[Harald Rosenthal]] (born 1937), German hydrobiologist known for his work in fish farming and ecology * [[Michael Sars]] (1809–1869), [[Norway|Norwegian]] theologian and biologist * [[Georg Ossian Sars]] (1837–1927), Norwegian marine biologist * [[Gunnar Thorson]] (1906–1971), Danish marine biologist * [[Ruth Turner]] (1915–2000), marine biologist * [[Charles Wyville Thompson]] (1832–1882), Scottish marine biologist
Source: [[List of biologists]].
== Marine Geologists and Geophysicists == * [[Robert Ballard]] (born 1942) * [[Kathryn D. Sullivan]] (born 1951), Marine Geologist, [[Astronaut]], Formally: Chief Scientist of NOAA, Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Environmental Observation and Prediction and Deputy Administrator for the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. Currently (4 June 2013) serving as Acting Under Secretary of Commerce for Oceans and Atmosphere and Acting NOAA Administrator.
== Oceanographers == :'''[[Oceanography]]''' (from the [[Greek language|greek]] words ''Ωκεανός'' meaning [[Ocean]] and ''γράφω'' meaning to write), also called '''oceanology''' or '''marine science''', is the branch of [[Earth Sciences]] that studies the [[Earth]]'s [[ocean]]s and [[sea]]s. It covers a wide range of topics, including [[marine organism]]s and [[ecosystem]] dynamics; [[ocean currents]], [[Water waves|waves]], and geophysical fluid dynamics; [[plate tectonics]] and the geology of the sea floor; and [[flux]]es of various chemical substances and physical properties within the ocean and across its boundaries. These diverse topics reflect multiple disciplines that oceanographers blend to further knowledge of the world ocean and understanding of processes within it: [[biology]], [[chemistry]], [[geology]], [[meteorology]], and [[physics]]. * [[Michèle Marie Fieux]] * [[John Knauss]] * [[Roger Revelle]] * [[Sylvia Earle]]
== Submersible Designers and Pilots == [[File:WCS Beebe Barton 600.jpg|thumb|right|Beebe (left) and Otis Barton with the bathysphere]] * [[William Beebe]] (July 29, 1877 – June 4, 1962) * [[Graham Hawkes]] * [[Edwin Albert Link]] (July 26, 1904 – September 7, 1981) * [[Phil Nuytten]] * [[John Mattera]] * [[Auguste Piccard]] * [[Jacques Piccard]] * [[Allyn Vine]] * [[Don Walsh]]
== [[Cave Diving|Cave Divers]] ([[Caver]]s and [[speleologist]]s) == :Cave diving is one of the most challenging and potentially dangerous kinds of diving and presents many [[Diving hazards and precautions|diving hazards]]. Cave diving is a form of [[penetration diving]], meaning that in an emergency a diver cannot ascend directly to the surface due to the cave's ceilings, and instead may have to swim horizontally. The underwater navigation through the cave system may be difficult and exit routes may be at considerable distance, requiring the diver to have sufficient [[breathing gas]] to make the journey, resulting in potential [[deep diving]] risks.<ref> "Cave diving - Hazards." Oneness Commitment. 1 1 <http://www.experiencefestival.com/cave_diving_-_hazards>.</ref>
* [[Graham Balcombe]] (8 March 1907 – 19 March 2000), a founder of the [[Cave Diving Group]] * [[George Benjamin (caver)|George Benjamin]], [[cave diving]] pioneer<ref name="Burgess 1">{{cite book|last=Burgess|first=Robert F.|authorlink=Robert Forrest Burgess|title=The Cave Divers|chapter=To the Cellars of the Sea|publisher=Aqua Quest Publications|location=[[Locust Valley, New York]]|year=1999|pages=154–166|isbn=1-881652-11-4|lccn=96-39661|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=LbwrLGZDMHMC&pg=PA154}}</ref> * [http://www.xray-mag.com/content/bozanic-burroughs-hasson-heinerth-and-hdsusa-honoured-beneath-sea-awards Jeff Bozanic] * [[Sheck Exley]] (April 1, 1949 – April 6, 1994), cave diving pioneer * [[Nuno Gomes (diver)|Nuno Gomes]] (born 1951), South African diver, holder of world records for [[deep diving]] and deepest cave dive * [[Jochen Hasenmayer]] (born 1941), German cave diver * [[Jarrod Jablonski]] (born 1969), pioneering technical diver and record setting cave diver * [[John Mattera]] (born 1962), technical cave diver mapping many uncharted cave systems in the Dominican Republic * [[Artur Kozłowski (speleologist)|Artur Kozłowski]] (17 October 1977 – 5 September 2011), Polish cave diver who died on a dive in Ireland * [[Jon Lindbergh]] (born 1932), oldest surviving son of [[Charles Lindbergh]] * [[Agnes Milowka]] (23 December 1981 – 27 February 2011), Australian technical diver, underwater photographer and author * [[David Shaw (diver)|David Shaw]] (1954–2005), Australian cave diver who died attempting to recover the body of another diver from [[Boesmansgat|Bushman's Hole]] in South Africa * [[Jack Sheppard (cave diver)|Jack Sheppard]] (31 March 1909 – 14 July 2001), pioneer of cave diving in the [[United Kingdom]] and a founder of the [[Cave Diving Group]] * Don Shirley (born 1957), English cave diver * [[Wesley C. Skiles]] (March 6, 1958 – July 21, 2010), documentary filmmaker * [[William Stone (caver)|Bill Stone]] (born 1952), American caver and explorer, known for exploring deep caves, sometimes with [[autonomous underwater vehicle]]
== First Generation Diving Safety Officers ==
A [[Diving Safety Officer]] (DSO) is a person (typically a University Official) appointed by an institution's responsible administrative officer or designee. He or she must be trained as a scientific diver, be a full member of the [[American Academy of Underwater Sciences]] and be an active underwater instructor from an internationally recognized certifying agency. He or she is responsible, for the conduct of the scientific diving program of the institution, including the conduct of training and certification, approval of dive plans, maintenance of diving records, and ensuring compliance with all relevant regulations.
This organizational structure goes back to the model developed at the [[Scripps Institution of Oceanography]] in the early 1950s. The model spread from there to the other campuses of the University of California, then to other California institutions and then nationwide. It served as the model accepted by the [[AAUS|American Academy of Underwater Sciences]] and OSHA.
Those individuals who were part of the first generation of Diving Officers often had the opportunity to participate in many different undersea exploration programs and made singular contributions to those programs as well as the world of diving and submersibles.
* [[Lloyd Austin]] - [[University of California at Berkeley]]

{{EngvarB|date=September 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=February 2015}} {{Refimprove|date=August 2009}} {{Infobox person | name = Manmohan Desai | image =Man Mohan Desai.jpg | imagesize = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date |df=yes|1937|2|26}}<ref name="Haham2005">{{cite book|author=Connie Haham|title=Manmohan Desai's Enchantment of the Mind|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=bnZsBQAAQBAJ&pg=PT20|date=1 December 2005|publisher=Roli Books Private Limited|isbn=978-93-5194-049-4|pages=20–}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Bombay]], [[Bombay Presidency]], [[British India]] | death_date = {{death date and age|df=yes|1994|3|1|1937|2|26}} | death_place = [[Mumbai]], [[Maharashtra]], [[India]] | mothertounge = | othername = | alma_mater = [[St. Xavier's College, Mumbai|St. Xavier's College]] | occupation = Film director, producer | yearsactive = 1960–1989 | spouse = Jeevanprabha Gandhi<ref>{{cite web|last1=Singh|first1=Kuldip|title=Obituary: Manmohan Desai|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/obituary-manmohan-desai-1426903.html|publisher=The Independent|accessdate=8 August 2015}}</ref> | children = [[Ketan Desai (director)|Ketan Desai]] | parents = {{unbulleted list| [[Kikubhai Desai]] |Kalavati}}<ref name=L&C>{{cite web|last1=Raje|first1=Niilesh A|title=Anhonee Ko Honee Karde: A Tribute To Manmohan Desai|url=http://learningandcreativity.com/anhonee-ko-honee-karde-a-tribute-to-manmohan-desai/|publisher=Learning & Creativity|accessdate=8 August 2015}}</ref> | website = }} '''Manmohan Desai''' (26 February 1937 – 1 March 1994) was a [[movie producer|producer]] and [[movie director|director]] of [[Indian movie]]s
== Family background == Manmohan Desai was of [[Gujarati people|Gujarati]] ancestry. His father, Kikubhai Desai,<ref>[https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1509216/ Kikubhai Desai]. IMDb</ref> was an Indian film producer and owner of Paramount Studios (later Filmalaya)<ref>Tejaswini Ganti 2004, "Bollywood: A Guide to Popular Hindi Cinema", Routeledge Guidebooks, New York and London.</ref> from 1931 to 1941. His productions, mainly stunt films, included ''Circus Queen'', ''Golden Gang'', and ''Sheikh Challi''.<ref>Connie Haham (2006) ''Enchantment of the Mind: Manmohan Desai's Films'', Roli Books, New Delhi, p 182.</ref> Manmohan Desai's older brother, Subhash Desai, became a producer in the 1950s<ref>[https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1194304/ Subhash Desai]. IMDb</ref> and gave Manmohan his first break with the Hindi film ''[[Chhalia]]'' (1960). Subhash later went on to produce ''[[Bluff Master (film)|Bluff Master]]'', ''[[Dharam Veer (1977 film)|Dharam Veer]]'', and ''[[Desh Premee]]'' with Manmohan as the director.
His wife was Jeevanprabha Desai. She died in April 1979. He was engaged to actress [[Nanda (actress)|Nanda]] from 1992 until the time of his death in 1994. He had one son Ketan Desai who is still involved in the film industry. Ketan is married to Kanchan Kapoor, daughter of [[Shammi Kapoor]] and [[Geeta Bali]].
On 1 March 1994, per news Manmohan Desai fell from the balcony in [[Girgaon]] as the rail he was leaning on collapsed and died.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Bawa|first1=Jyoti Sharma|title=With Nanda's death, I have lost a very good friend: Actor Mala Sinha|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/with-nanda-s-death-i-have-lost-a-very-good-friend-mala-sinha/article1-1200215.aspx|publisher=Hindustan Times|accessdate=8 August 2015}}</ref> Very little is known about his death except that he was suffering from chronic back pain. Rumours of him committing suicide have not been confirmed.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Mishra|first1=Rashmi|title=Accident, Suicide or Murder? The mysterious deaths in Bollywood|url=http://www.india.com/showbiz/accident-suicide-or-murder-the-mysterious-deaths-in-8179/|publisher=India.com|accessdate=8 August 2015}}</ref>
== Career == Manmohan Desai was known for his family-centered, action-song-and-dance films which catered to the tastes of the Indian masses and through which he achieved great success. His movies defined a new genre called [[masala (film genre)|masala]] films. A common theme in his films were the lost and found plot where family members would be separated and reunited.
He had a string of hits with [[Amitabh Bachchan]] in the 70s and early 80s which helped cement Bachchan's status as a [[superstar]] of Indian cinema. He worked with Amitabh on ''[[Amar Akbar Anthony]]'', ''[[Parvarish (1977 film)|Parvarish]]'', ''[[Suhaag (1979 film)|Suhaag]]'', ''[[Naseeb (1981 film)|Naseeb]]'', ''[[Desh Premee]]'', ''[[Coolie (1983 Hindi film)|Coolie]]'', ''[[Mard (1985 film)|Mard]]'' and ''[[Ganga Jamuna Saraswati]]''; all but the last were box office successes. He was one of the directors who had a special working relationship with [[Amitabh Bachchan]], the others being [[Yash Chopra]], [[Prakash Mehra]], [[Ramesh Sippy]], and [[Hrishikesh Mukherjee]]. Of these, only [[Yash Chopra]] went on to make hits beyond the 1980s.
He often worked with the same actors in several different films:
*Jeetendra in ''Dharam Veer'' (1977) after ''Bhai Ho To Aisa'' *Shatrughan Sinha in ''Naseeb after ''Bhai Ho To Aisa'', ''Shararat'' and Aa Gale Lag Jaa (1973) and ''Rampur Ka Lakshman'' (1972) *Shashi Kapoor in ''Suhaag'' after ''Aa Gale Lag Jaa'' (1973) *Shammi Kapoor in ''Parvarish'' (1977) as a father figure after ''Bluffmaster'' (1963) *Randhir Kapoor in ''Chacha Bhatija'' (1977) after ''Rampur Ka Lakshman'' (1972).
Apart from Bachchan, Manmohan Desai worked with such leading male stars as [[Raj Kapoor]] in the 1960 film ''[[Chhalia]]'', [[Shammi Kapoor]] in "[[Bluffmaster]]" (1963), [[Rajesh Khanna]] in ''[[Sachaa Jhutha]]'' (1970) and ''[[Roti]]'' (1974), [[Randhir Kapoor]] in ''[[Raampur Ka Lakshman]]'' (1972), [[Shashi Kapoor]] in ''[[Aa Gale Lag Jaa (1973 film)|Aa Gale Lag Jaa]]'', [[Dharmendra]] in ''[[Dharam Veer (1977 film)|Dharam Veer]]'' (1977). 1977 was an exceptional year for him. All four of his films released that year were huge hits: ''[[Parvarish (1977 film)|Parvarish]]'', ''[[Amar Akbar Anthony]]'', ''[[Chacha Bhatija]]'' and ''[[Dharam Veer (1977 film)|Dharam Veer]]''. The first two were with Amitabh, and the latter two were with [[Dharmendra]].
Manmohan Desai worked with writers such as [[Salim-Javed]], [[Prayag Raaj]], [[K.K.Shukla]], and [[Kader Khan]], and lyricists such as [[Anand Bakshi]], [[Sahir Ludhianvi]], [[Qamar Jalalabadi]], [[Gulshan Bawra]], and Shailendra. Early in his career he worked with composers Rahul Dev Burman, [[Kalyanji Anandji]], later with [[Laxmikant Pyarelal]] and in the 1980s with music composer [[Anu Malik]].
Out of the 20 films that Desai directed in his career span of 29 years (1960–1989), as many as 13 films were stupendous hits. His success ratio was 65 percent in an industry where flops abound. His favourite playback singer was Mohd Rafi. In most of his movie, Mohd Rafi was used to sing all of his songs. When Kishore Kumar's voice was frequently used on Amitabh Bachchan by other Directors, he used Mohd Rafi's voice on Amitabh Bachcan in films like Suhaag and Naseeb. His biggest hits of Mohd Rafi song was Pardah Hai Pardah from Amar Akbar Anthony and John Jani Janardhan from Naseeb. Manmohan Desai once said that Mohd Rafi's voice is God's voice.
Towards the end of his career, Desai's previously successful stories and style began to lose favour with audiences. Critics accused him of self-parody. His last film as a director ''[[Ganga Jamuna Saraswati]]'' and the films he produced with his son Ketan Desai directing, ''[[Allah Rakha (film)|Allah Rakha]]'' (1986), ''[[Toofan (1989 film)|Toofan]]'' (1989) and ''[[Anmol]]'' (1993) failed at the box office.

[[File:Eustache Le Sueur - The Sacrifice of Manoah, 1640-1650.jpg|thumb|Manoah and [[Wife of Manoah|his barren wife]] sacrifice a [[Sheep|ram]] to the [[angel of the Lord]] (above); Manoah's wife wears a [[wimple]] in [[Eustache Le Sueur]]'s ''The Sacrifice of Manoah'', 1640-1650.]] '''Manoah''' ({{Lang-he-n|מָנ֫וֹחַ}} ''Mānoaḥ'') is a figure from the [[Book of Judges]] 13:1-23 and 14:2-4 of the [[Hebrew Bible]]. His name means "rest" or "quiet".<ref>[http://www.keyway.ca/htm2001/20010506.htm Manoah by Wayne Blank]</ref>
== Family == According to the Bible, Manoah was of the [[tribe of Dan]] and lived in the city of [[Zorah]]. He married [[Wife of Manoah|one woman]], who was barren. Her name is not mentioned in the Bible, but according to tradition she was called [[Hazelelponi|Hazelelponi or Zʻllpunith]].<ref>''Babylonian Talmud: Tractate Bava Batra [http://www.halakhah.com/bababathra/bababathra_91.html Folio 91]''.</ref> She was a daughter of Etam and sister of Ishma.
Manoah and [[Wife of Manoah|his wife]]<ref>[http://www.wordlibrary.co.uk/article.php?id=172 Manoah's wife]</ref> were the parents of famous judge [[Samson]]. According to Rabbinic tradition, they also had a daughter called Nishyan or Nashyan.<ref>[http://jewishencyclopedia.com/articles/13071-samson Samson, Jewish Encyclopedia.] "The mother of Samson [was named] Zlelponith, and his sister, Nashyan."</ref><ref>Porter, J. R. (2000). ''The Illustrated Guide to the Bible''. New York: Barnes & Noble Books. p. 75. {{ISBN|0-7607-2278-1}}.</ref>
== Birth of Samson == Manoah and his wife were childless, but an [[angel of the Lord]] appeared to Manoah’s wife and told her that she would give birth to a son. The child was to be dedicated from the womb as a [[Nazirite]], which entailed restrictions on his diet, which the angel spelled out in detail. The woman (whose name is not mentioned in the Bible) told her husband, "A man of God came to me". Manoah prayed and the angel returned to instruct the both of them. After the angel left, Manoah tells his wife, "We shall surely die, because we have seen God."<ref>{{bibleref||Judges|13:22}}</ref>
Together with his wife, Manoah subsequently tried to dissuade Samson from marrying a [[Philistines|Philistine]] woman, but traveled with him to [[Timnah]] for the wedding ceremony when they were unable to do so.
Samson's birth has special importance for some Christians (primarily [[Blessed Virgin Mary (Roman Catholic)|Catholics]]), because of its similarity to the [[Annunciation]] to the [[Mary (mother of Jesus)|Virgin Mary]].
After Samson's death, his family recovers his body and buries him near the tomb of Manoah.
== In culture == *In 1914 American film ''[[Samson (1914 film)|Samson]]'', Manoah was played by [[George Periolat]], while his wife was played by [[Lule Warrenton]].<ref>{{IMDb title|id=0004558|title=Samson}}</ref> * In the 1949 film ''[[Samson and Delilah (1949 film)|Samson and Delilah]]'' (starring [[Victor Mature]] and [[Hedy Lamarr]]), Manoah is played by Charles Evans in an uncredited appearance. *In 1996 film ''[[Samson and Delilah (1996 film)|Samson and Delilah]]'', Manoah, played by [[Paul Freeman (actor)|Paul Freeman]], is shown as a poor old man. His wife is called [[Mara (name)|Mara]] in this film. *In the 2018 film ''[[Samson (2018 film)|Samson]]'', Manoah is played by [[Rutger Hauer]] and his wife (called Zealphonis) is played by [[Lindsay Wagner]]. {{Commons category|Manoah}}

revision.comment: Clearing up misconceptions about Buddha's conception and birth.
revision.text:
{{Religious text primary|date=October 2017}} [[Image:Sermon in the Deer Park depicted at Wat Chedi Liem-KayEss-1.jpeg|thumb|right|150px|Painting of the first sermon depicted at [[Wat Chedi Liem]] in [[Thailand]]]] According to Buddhist texts, [[Gautama Buddha]] possessed several superhuman powers and abilities; however, due to an understanding of the workings of the skeptical mind and how the display of [[miracle]]s can be abused by unscrupulous people, he reportedly responded to a request for miracles by saying, "...I dislike, reject and despise them,"The Long Discourses of the Buddha, A Translation of the Dīgha Níkāya by Maurice Walshe, Wisdom Publication, Boston 1995, p. 176 {{full|date=November 2012}} and refused to comply. ==Miraculous birth== {{Main|Gautama Buddha#Conception and birth|Miraculous births}} [[File:The infant Buddha taking the Seven Steps.jpg|thumb|The infant Buddha taking the Seven Steps. [[Greco-Buddhist art]] of [[Gandhara]].]] It is said that immediately after his birth, he stood up, took seven steps north, and uttered:{{cite web|title=The Life of the Buddha: The Birth of the Prince|url=http://www.buddhanet.net/e-learning/buddhism/lifebuddha/2lbud.htm|publisher=BuddhaNet}}
"I am chief of the world,
Eldest am I in the world,
Foremost am I in the world.
This is the last birth.
There is now no more coming to be."
Furthermore, every place the baby Buddha placed his foot, a [[lotus (genus)|lotus]] flower bloomed. There is a claim that the Buddha's birth was miraculous via his mother's dream of a white elephant.{{cite web|title=The Buddha: Story & Teachings|url=https://www.pbs.org/thebuddha/birth-and-youth/|publisher=[[PBS]]}} This does not mean that the Buddha had a virgin birth like the Christian gospels of the birth of Jesus Christ. Buddha's mother was not a virgin, but Buddha was the product of a miraculous conception and a miraculous birth. The [[Mahāvastu]] and [[Lalitavistara Sūtra|Lalitavistara]] explicitly state that no carnal act took place for Buddha's conception; the [[Buddhacarita]] is ambiguous. Buddha did also have a miraculous birth. He was born out of the side of his mother. In the Mahapadana-sutra, Digha ii. 12, is the description of the incarnation of the [[Vipassī Buddha]]. "Now Vipassi, brethren, when, as Bodhisat, he ceased to belong to the hosts of the heaven of Delight, descended into his mother’s womb mindful and self-possessed." ==Other miracles== Other miracles and powers that [[Gautama Buddha]] was said to have possessed and exercised include the six higher knowledges ([[Abhijna]]): [[Iddhi]], [[telepathy]], [[Clairaudience|super-hearing]], [[third eye|divine seeing]], and [[Akashic records|seeing past lives]]. These are described in the ''Mahasihanada Sutta'' and other [[Sūtra|sutta]]s in the [[Pali canon]].[http://www.accesstoinsight.org/tipitaka/mn/mn.012.ntbb.html Maha-sihanada Sutta] [[The Twin Miracle]] at [[Sravasti]] is also considered as the Buddhist miracle par excellence.Relics of the Buddha, John Strong, Motilal Banarsidass Publisher, 2007 [https://books.google.com/books?id=xqAB6PKyP98C&pg=PA177 p.177] ==See also== * [[Iddhi]] * [[Miracles of Jesus]] * [[Siddhi]] * [[Vibhuti]] ==References== ==Bibliography== *Analayo (2016). [http://www.jocbs.org/index.php/jocbs/article/view/131/154 Levitation in Early Buddhist Discourse], Journal of the Oxford Centre for Buddhist Studies 10, 11-26 *Analayo (2015). [http://www.jocbs.org/index.php/jocbs/article/view/127/150 The Buddha’s Fire Miracles], Journal of the Oxford Centre for Buddhist Studies 9, 9-42 ==External links== *[http://www.parami.org/buddhistanswers/what_about_miracles.htm parami.org] *[http://www.palikanon.com/english/pali_names/y/yamaka_paatihaariya.htm palikanon.com] *[http://www.buddhanet.net/e-learning/buddhism/lifebuddha/contents1.htm buddhanet.net] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20061013111723/http://web.ukonline.co.uk/buddhism/tinhla01.htm ukonline.co.uk] *[http://www.ignca.nic.in/jatak079.htm ignca.nic.in] *[http://www.bartleby.com/45/3/104.html bartleby.com] *[http://www.seasite.niu.edu/crossroads/raymond/events.htm seasite.niu.edu] *[https://suttacentral.net/ suttacentral.net] {{Gautama Buddha}} {{Buddhism topics}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Miracles Of Gautama Buddha}} [[Category:Gautama Buddha]] [[Category:Miracles]]

'''Omar Abdalla Aboelazm''' (born 25 May 1980) is a [[Sweden|Swedish]] citizen who was arrested in [[Denmark]] in 2010 over a [[2010 Copenhagen terror plot|suspected terror plot]] against the Danish newspaper ''[[Jyllands-Posten]]''.<ref name="dn_20101231_0842">{{cite news |title=Här är svenskarna som häktats |url=http://www.dn.se/nyheter/sverige/har-ar-svenskarna-som-haktats |newspaper=[[Dagens Nyheter]] |date=31 December 2010 |accessdate=31 December 2010 |language=Swedish}}</ref>
Aboelazm was born in [[Äppelbo]], [[Vansbro Municipality]], [[Dalarna County]], [[Sweden]], to a Swedish mother and an [[Egypt]]ian father.<ref name="dn_20101231_0842"/><ref name="svd_20101231_0908">{{cite news |title=Vad gäller saken? |url=http://www.svd.se/nyheter/inrikes/vad-galler-saken_5839605.svd |newspaper=[[Svenska Dagbladet]] |date=31 December 2010 |accessdate=31 December 2010 |language=Swedish}}</ref><ref name="expressen_20101231_1330">{{cite news |first1=Johanna |last1=Ekström |first2=Jessica |last2=Josefsson |first3=Arne |last3=Lapidus |title=Så blev Omar en misstänkt terrorist |url=http://www.expressen.se/nyheter/1.2273673/sa-blev-omar-en-misstankt-terrorist |newspaper=[[Expressen]] |date=31 December 2010 |accessdate=31 December 2010 |language=Swedish}}</ref> He has two half-siblings on his mother's side and five half-siblings on his father's side.<ref name="svd_20101231_0908"/> One of his half-sisters is a neighbor to [[Sahbi Zalouti]], one of the other suspects who was arrested in the same case.<ref name="svd_20101231_0908"/> He is unmarried and has no children.<ref name="svd_20101231_0908"/>
According to an article in ''[[Expressen]]'', Aboelazm has [[Asperger syndrome]].<ref name="expressen_20101231_1330"/> In 2000 he was sentenced to psychiatric treatment after an assault in 1999 when he also made sexual advances against a 25-year-old woman.<ref name="dn_20101230_1521">{{cite news |first1=Anders |last1=Forsström |first2=Clas |last2=Svahn |title=Terroristhäktade tidigare dömda för vålds- och sexualbrott |url=http://www.dn.se/nyheter/sverige/en-av-de-terrormisstankta-kand-sedan-tidigare |newspaper=[[Dagens Nyheter]] |date=30 December 2010 |accessdate=30 December 2010 |language=Swedish}}</ref> He had then also molested a 23-year-old woman, a 16-year-old girl, a 13-year-old girl and three 15-year-old girls at six different occasions.<ref name="dn_20101230_1521"/> During a psychiatric examination in 2002, doctors concluded that Aboelazm suffered from a "grave mental disorder" and was in need of "psychiatric treatment associated with deprivation of freedom or other coercion".<ref name="dn_20101230_1521"/>
While detained in Denmark he was suspected of planned new attacks as police found instructions to construct weaponry in his cell along with plans of public places.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://ekstrabladet.dk/112/article4038157.ece|title=Anklager: Planlagde ny terror fra cellen|access-date=2018-10-13|language=da}}</ref> After being transferred to Swedish prison, he received a number of warnings for refusing to work and disorderly conduct.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://doku.nu/2018/10/08/terroristen-forsokte-radikalisera-sina-medfangar/|title=Terroristen försökte radikalisera sina medfångar – Doku.nu|website=doku.nu|language=sv-SE|access-date=2018-10-13}}</ref>

revision.comment: Robot - Moving category Arab people to [[:Category:Arabs]] per [[WP:CFD|CFD]] at [[Wikipedia:Categories for discussion/Log/2018 July 19]].
revision.text:
{{More citations needed|date=June 2018}}{{History of Morocco}} The '''Oulad Tidrarin''' ({{lang-ar|أولأد تيدرارين}}) is a [[Sahrawi people|Sahrawi]] [[tribe]] of [[Arab]] origins, formerly considered to be of [[Ansar (Islam)|Ansar]] status. They speak [[Hassaniya]] [[Arabic Language|Arabic]]. They are [[Islam|Muslims]], belonging to the [[Maliki]] school of [[Sunni]] [[Islam]]. They live mainly in Western Sahara but also in Morocco and Mauritania.{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=MdaAdBC-_S4C&pg=PA473&dq=Oulad+Tidrarin&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjRp_SxtMrbAhUJKMAKHYQeAAIQ6AEILzAB#v=onepage&q=Oulad%20Tidrarin&f=false|title=The Peoples of Africa: An Ethnohistorical Dictionary|last=Olson|first=James Stuart|date=1996|publisher=Greenwood Publishing Group|year=|isbn=9780313279188|location=|pages=473|language=en}} ==Origins== The Oulad Tidrarin is one of the oldest [[Arab]] tribes that settled the [[Saguia el-Hamra]] and [[Río de Oro]] areas of Northwest Africa, their original home. Many live in the [[Cape Bojador]] and the coastline of the south of [[Morocco]], some on the coast of [[Saguia el-Hamra]] and some branches live in the south and east of [[Mauritania]]. There are some members of the Uladsliman and Lidadsa in subgroups in [[Mali]]. The name Tidrarin is [[Berber languages|Berber]] and means 'small mouintains'. It is the [[diminutive]] form of ''idrarin''. i.e. 'mountains'. ==Religious activism== The tribe has established centres for the spread of [[Islamic culture]], particularly along the Atlantic coast region. They have received recognition from the Moroccan sultans for their work in this area. ==Clan subdivisions== Oulad Tidrarin can be divided into eleven clans and twenty-three subclans. The clans are: 1. Almkalcha (Lamghalcha) :They consist of five subclans: :* Ahl Hajj :* Asnubat :* Lamnabha :* Ahl Ahmed Msska :* Sawalih 2. Oulad Sidiasin Ben Aalilaassam :They consist of three subclans: :* Oulad Sliman :* Da'anin :* Ahl Abrehmat 3. Lidadssa (Alidadsa)
4. Alabobat (Laaboubat)
5. Oulad Sidahmad Boghanbur (Oulad Boughanbour) : This clan consists of six subclans: :* Lafaaris :* Oulad Yassin :* Oulad Abdallah (Oulad Moussa, Oulad Boucheguer) :* Oulad Ismail :* Oulad Abderrahman (Ahlsteilah and Arhailat) :* Ahl Talbaali 6. Al Husinat (Lahssinat)
7. Oulad Ali (Al Alaouiin the brave clan in the tribe)
8. Lahmaidat
9. Ahl Yara
10. Oulad Bousshab
11. Oulad El Ghazi All of these tribes gathered in Uladtidrrarin flying are attributed to the Ansar;furthermore,they belong to the main tribe of Azd which contains many tribes ,likewise tribe of chuhuh in UAE The majority adheres to certified documents to prove their Ansar parentage. Some of the documents are stored in patches of skin and some in patches of old paper. Most clans meet in the "Aalilasam." A Whole, and who was also Sidaali. It Ali ben Abiazi bin Ibrahim bin Hannin bin Sarhan. And his sons: Aaz nicknamed Merbaialitami, Grandfather of Oulad Boughanbur and the Oulad Ali, Aoub, Grandfather of Alabobat, Ahmed Ben Yaddas, Grandfather Alidadssa Moughlich, Grandfather of Lamghalcha, Sidi Yassin, Grandfather of Oulad Sliman, Ahl Braihmat and Da'anin, Sidi Al Ghazi, Grandfather of Oulad Al Ghazi, ==See also== * [[Beni Hassan]] * [[Maliq]] * [[Banu Hilal]] * [[Oulad Delim]] * [[Reguibat]] ==References== {{Ethnic groups in Morocco}} [[Category:Ethnic groups in Morocco]] [[Category:Arabs]] [[Category:Tribes of Arabia]] [[Category:Arabs in North Africa]] [[Category:Sahrawi people]]

contributor.username: Me, Myself, and I are Here

revision.text:
'''Pangool''' (in [[Serer language|Serer]] and [[Cangin languages|Cangin]]) singular: '''Fangool''' (var : ''Pangol'' and ''Fangol''),<ref>[R. P. Crétois, Dictionnaire Sereer-Français, Dakar, CLAD, t. 1 (1972), t. 2 (1973), t. 3 (1974), t. 4 (1975), t. 5 (1976), t. 6 (1977), passim.] and [Abbé L. Diouf, L’homme dans le monde (Vision sereer), communication aux Journées Africaines de Théologie, polygraphié, s. d., p. 6.] [in] Martin & Becker, "Lieux de culte et emplacements célèbres dans les pays sereer", pp 7–8</ref> are the ancient saints and ancestral spirits of the [[Serer people]] of [[Senegal]], the [[Gambia]] and [[Mauritania]]. The Pangool play a crucial role in [[Serer religion]] and [[Timeline of Serer history|history]]. In a religious sense, they act as [[intercession of saints|interceders]] between the living world and the supreme being [[Roog]] or [[Koox]].<ref>[[Henry Gravrand|Gravrand, Henry]], "La Civilisation Sereer – Pangool", vol.2, Les Nouvelles Editions Africaines du Senegal, (1990), p 278, {{ISBN|2-7236-1055-1}}</ref> In a historical sense, the [[States headed by ancient Serer Lamanes|ancient Serer village and town founders]] called [[Lamane]]s were believed to be accompanied by a group of Pangool as they travelled in search of land to exploit. These Lamanes became guardians of Serer religion and created shrines in honour of the Pangool, thus becoming the custodians of the Pangool cult.<ref name="Gal">Galvan, Dennis Charles, "The State Must Be Our Master of Fire : How Peasants Craft Culturally Sustainable Development in Senegal", Berkeley, [[University of California Press]] (2004), pp 53, 185</ref>
There are several Pangool in Serer religion and each one is associated with a specific attribute, have their own [[:Category:Serer holy places|sacred place of worship]], means of worship, etc. The symbol of the Pangool is the [[snake|serpent]], represented by two coiled snakes.<ref>Gravrand, "Pangool", p 9</ref>
==Etymology and terminology == *''Fangool'' – the singular of Pangool *''Pangool'' – a group of Fangool *''O Yaal Pangool'' (var : ''yaal pangool'') – the masters of the Pangool cult, i.e. the Serer priestly class – [[Saltigue]]s, previously the [[Lamane|Lamanic class]].<ref>Kalis, p 300</ref> *''Pangool ke'' – the ancestors<ref>Kalis, p 122</ref>
The etymology of ''fangool'' comes from the Serer phrase ''Fang Qool'' which means the sacred [[snake|serpent]]<ref>Gravrand, "Pangool", p 311</ref> the plural of which is ''pangool''. Fangool means serpent.<ref name="Pangoo p 13">Gravrand, "Pangool", p 313</ref>
==Types== There are two main types of Pangool: non-human Pangool and human Pangool. Both are sacred and ancient, but the former is more ancient as a general rule. The non-human Pangool include ancient sacred places with vital spiritual energies and personalized as such.<ref name="Pangoo p 13"/> These Pangool generally are the personifications of [[Nature|natural]] forces.<ref>Granvrand, "Pangool", p 327</ref> Human Pangool on the other hand became Pangool once they are canonized after death. Thus some are ancient, others are [[Medieval Era|medieval]]. Through their intercession with the divine, they form a link which transmits vital energies. Not every dead ancient ancestor is canonized as Pangool.<ref name="Pangoo p 13"/><ref name="Kal 122-3"/>
Pangool can be subdivided further into:
:1. those Pangool who are known and revered in a particular region, such as the tombs of ancient Serer kings and queens<ref name="Cr">{{fr}} R. P. Crétois, "Dictionnaire Sereer-Français", Dakar, CLAD, t. 1 (1972), t. 2 (1973), t. 3 (1974), t. 4 (1975), t. 5 [in] Martin & Becker (pp 7–8)</ref> (see [[Serer ancient history]] and [[Serer creation myth]]) :2. those Pangool who are known and revered in a particular village or town, such as the [[States headed by ancient Serer Lamanes|Serer village or town founders]]<ref name="Cr"/> :3. those Pangool who are known, revered and venerated in a particular square such as the founder of the square<ref name="Cr"/> :4. a Fangool made known to an individual and thus became the personal Fangool of the individual in question,<ref name="Cr"/> such as the Fangool ''Ginaaru'' (the personal Fangool of [[Maad a Sinig Maysa Wali Jaxateh Manneh]], var: Maysa Waaly Dione,<ref name="pan344">Gravrand, "Pangool", p 344</ref> the first [[Guelowar]] king of [[Kingdom of Sine|Sine]], reigned: 1350–1370<ref name="Sarr">[[Alioune Sarr|Sarr, Alioune]], "[[Alioune Sarr#Histoire du Sine-Saloum|Histoire du Sine-Saloum]]" (Sénégal), Introduction, bibliographie et notes par Charles Becker. Version légèrement remaniée par rapport à celle qui est parue en 1986–87. p 19</ref>). :5. those Pangool whose names are [[lost history|lost to history]] or did not disclose their identity, but are well known for certain events in Serer history, such as the seizure of certain historical figures, etc.<ref name="Cr"/>
In addition to these, Pangool can be further categorized depending on their character and nature, such as:
:1. ''[[Blood]]'' or ''[[red#Courage and sacrifice|red]] Pangool'': those who require the sacrifice of domesticated animals (i.e. [[cattle]]) in their veneration, or alcohol<ref name="Pan38"/> :2. ''[[Milk]] Pangool'': those who require the offerings of milk<ref name="Pan38"/> :3. ''[[Water]] Pangool': those who reside in water, etc.,<ref name="Pan38"/>
Blood is a sign of life in Serer [[cosmogony]]<ref name="Pan38"/> and these types of Pangool fulfill a vital role in Serer society, and are seen as one of the most ancient and powerful. The Fangool Ngolum Joof (var: Ngolum Diouf) is one of these ''blood Pangool''.<ref name="Pan38"/> In many cases, offerings of alcohol rather than the sacrifice of [[domestication|domesticated animals]] are made to these ''blood Pangool''.<ref name="Pan38">Gravrand, "Pangool", p 338</ref> In contrast to the ''blood Pangool'', the ''milk Pangool'' such as Moussa Sarr, Njemeh (var: Ndiémé) of Languème and Njoxona, etc., are those Pangool who are peaceful in nature and character. They even reject anything that symbolizes violence or things that may evoke destruction or death, i.e. iron, weapons, gunpowder, blood and the colour red. They usually are the protectors of Serer cities and the defenders of the weak.<ref name="Pan38"/>
==History==
===Early history=== {{main|Timeline of Serer history|States headed by ancient Serer Lamanes|Lamane}} The history regarding the veneration of the Pangool is found within the [[hermeneutics]] of Serer religion, oral tradition and archaeological discoveries. Prior to the widespread veneration of the Pangool, the religious habit of the ancient Serers included holding prayers at the beginning of the rainy season. The branches of the ''Njambayargin'' tree ([[bauhinia rufescens]]<ref>{{fr}} Lericollais, André, "La mort des arbres à Sob, en pays Sereer" (Sénégal), pp 3–5 [http://horizon.documentation.ird.fr/exl-doc/pleins_textes/doc34-08/30676.pdf]</ref>) were fetched by these ancient people because they believed the tree to possess elements which boosted the growth of their crops and produce much fruit. Ritual prayers were made to the supreme spirit [[Roog]] (or [[Koox]] among the [[Cangin languages|Cangin]]), totally distinct from the prayers that would later become afforded to other Serer spiritual entities such as the Pangool.<ref name="Pangool pp 283-4">Gravrand, "Pagool", pp 283–4</ref> In [[Serer creation myth|Serer cosmogony]], trees play a vital role in the [[Cosmogony|creation narrative]], as they were the first things created on [[Earth]] by the divine, followed by [[animals]] (non-[[humans]]).<ref>Niangoran-Bouah, Georges, "L'univers Akan des poids à peser l'or : les poids dans la société", Les nouvelles éditions africaines – MLB, (1987), p 25, {{ISBN|2723614034}}</ref><ref>[[Universität Frankfurt am Main]], Frobenius-Institut, Deutsche Gesellschaft für Kulturmorphologie, Frobenius Gesellschaft, "Paideuma: Mitteilungen zur Kulturkunde, Volumes 43–44", F. Steiner (1997), pp 144–5, (Henry Gravrand, "La civilisation Sereer -Pangool" [in]) {{ISBN|3515028420}}</ref> The exact date as to when the Pangool cult became prevalent cannot be stated with a degree of accuracy.
===Medieval Era=== {{main|Lamane Jegan Joof|Tukar}} [[Lamane Jegan Joof]] founder of Tukar c. 11th century, is reported to have been accompanied by a group of Pangool when he migrated from [[Lambaye Arrondissement|Lambaye]] with his brother Ndik following a disagreement with his relative the king of Lambaye.<ref>Galvan, Dennis Charles, The State Must Be Our Master of Fire: How Peasants Craft Culturally Sustainable Development in Senegal, University of California Press, Berkeley (2004), pp 109–111, 80, 2–281 {{ISBN|9780520235915}}</ref><ref>Bressers, Hans, Rosenbaum, Walter A., Achieving sustainable development: the challenge of governance across social scales, Greenwood Publishing Group, (2003) p. 151 {{ISBN|0275978028}}</ref> After his migration, he founded Tukar, previously in the Serer pre-colonial [[Kingdom of Sine]],<ref>Gravrand, "Pangool, p 241</ref> now part of independent [[Senegal]]. Tukar is one of the [[:Category:Serer holy places|Serer holy sites]], and the Pangool affiliated with it are devotedly venerated in the Serer religious calendar, such as the '[[Serer religion#Raan Festival|Raan festival]] which takes place once a year on the second Thursday after the [[new moon]] in April. The descendants of Lamane Jegan Joof (the [[Joof family]] of Tukar) play a vital role in this religious affair.
==Serer religion== {{Serer religion}} {{Further|Serer religion|Serer creation myth}} The Pangool are related to the [[Transcendence (religion)|transcendence]] of the divine. In the Serer home, the altar of the Pangool can not conceal that of the divine.<ref>Gravrand, "Pangool", p 305</ref>
The Pangool provide the vital energies relating to the realities of the [[Serer people]] especially those forces outside the control of humanity. The religious practices and representations of the Pangool helps the Serer people dominate the hostile forces of nature, hence the advent of the Pangool veneration.<ref name="pan">Gravrand, "Pangool", pp 307–8</ref> Through their sacred intercession with the divine, these Pangool act as protectors and transmitters of vital energy to the world of the living. They can be humans, plants, animals, places, supernatural beings, etc.<ref name="pan"/><ref>[[Louis Diène Faye|Faye, Louis Diène]], "Mort et Naissance le monde Sereer", Les Nouvelles Editions Africaines (1983), p 43, {{ISBN|2-7236-0868-9}}</ref> Animals and trees are viewed by the Serers as extended relatives of human beings, because they came from the same divine [[placenta]] at the time of the [[Creation myth|coronation]].
Many Pangool are spirits of early ancestors who had died. They represent both Pangool of the paternal line (''pangool o kurcala'') and those of the maternal line (''pangool o ƭeen yaay''). These ancestors guide and protect their descendants. Many [[:Category:Serer families|Serer families]] have a master of the cult who knows how to evokes the ancestor. The earlier Pangool were not human beings, but superior beings created by [[Roog]] at the time human beings were created. They were believed to have been created by the divine in order to help human kind. It is for this reason why the terms Pangool and ''Nguus'' (Serer word for genie<ref>Kalis, p 153</ref>) are sometimes used interchangeably.<ref name="Kal 122-3">Kalis, pp 122–123</ref> Because some Pangool are linked to Serer lineages, only the head of the lineage schooled in the rituals can make a libation to the relevant Pangool or Fangool (the ancestor).<ref name="Pangool p 352">Gravrand, "Pangool", 352</ref>
In the [[Metempsychosis|other world]], the ancestors are the actual carrying-holders of transcendent sacred energies. However, the Pangool are superior in title because they were not transformed in the sacred energy. Thus the distinction between a ''fangool'' (non-human) and a human-ancestor lies in the mode of their participation in the transcendence. In either case, Roog is the first source of the transcendence of sacred energies.<ref>Kalis, p 123-4</ref><ref>Gravrand, "Pangool", p 330</ref>
Offerings of fruits, vegetables, crops, milk, or the sacrifice of domesticated animals are made to the Pangool in different places, eg: at the foot of trees, in forests, at community shrines, etc. There are Pangools whose scope is therapeutic, those who deliver justice (see also [[Takhar]] – spirit of justice) and those who are personal Pangool<ref>Gravrand, "Pangool", p 342-4</ref>
==List of Serer Pangool== The following table provides a sample of Pangool, their attributes and the part of [[:Category:Serer country|Serer country]] they protect ''':'''
{| class="wikitable" |- ! Name of Fangool!! Protector of !! Attributes / comments |- | Laga Ndong || [[Foundiougne Department]] ([[Djilor Arrondissement|Djilor]] and Peithie) || Canonized king of the Pangool during the reign of [[Maad a Sinig]] Waasila Faye<ref>Gravrand, "Pangool", p 363</ref> (king of [[Kingdom of Sine|Sine]], in the 15th century<ref>Gravrand, "Pangool", p 386</ref>). Homage made to him at the festival of ''Tourou Peithie'', one of the religious festivals in the [[Serer calendar]].<ref>{{fr}} Niang, Mor Sadio, "CEREMONIES ET FÊTES TRADITIONNELLES", [in] Ethiopiques n<sup>o</sup> 31 révue socialiste de culture négro-africaine 3e trimestre (1982) [http://ethiopiques.refer.sn/spip.php?article905]</ref> Veneration headed by the ''Taa'boor'' matriclan (var : ''Tabor'').<ref name="Pangool p 352"/> |- | Njoxona || Nakhar village in [[Niakhar Arrondissement|Nakhar]] || Village founded by Jaan Fadé<ref>Gravrand, "Pangool", p 320</ref> represented by the [[Python (genus)|python]]. Homage headed by the Jaan clan.<ref name="Becs">{{fr}} Martin, Victor & Becker, Charles, "Lieux de culte et emplacements célèbres dans les pays sereer" (Sénégal), Publié dans le Bulletin de l’[[Institut Fondamental d'Afrique Noire]], Tome 41, Série B, n° 1, janvier 1979, p. 133-189 (pp 15–34) [http://ucadao.s3.amazonaws.com/agorae/2009311111736/V.Martin(a).pdf]</ref> Njoxona is a ''milk Fangool''.<ref name="Pan38"/> |- | Mindiss (var : ''Mindis'')|| [[Fatick Region]] || A female protector of the Fatick Region, offering made to the [[Sine River|River Sine]]. She appears to humans in the form of a [[manatee]],<ref>Kalis, p 123</ref> one of the best known Fangool. She possess the attributes of a typical ''water Fangool'', yet at the same time she is a blood Fangool.<ref>Gravrand, "Pangool", p 327</ref> |- | Julang Joof and Ngojil Joof<ref>Variation : Dioulang Diouf & Ngojil Diouf (French spelling in [[Senegal]] respectively), the surname Joof (English spelling in the [[Gambia]]) or Diouf (French spelling in Senegal) is spelt ''Juuf'' or ''Juf'' in [[Serer language]]. ''Juuf'' is the proper spelling of the surname Joof/Diouf.</ref>|| Ngol and several others || Husband and wife protectors of Ngol and several villages and towns within its vicinity, where the ceremony and offerings are made to the sacred tree of Ñaawul (var : Naawul) believed to be the sacred tree of these two.<ref>Gravrand, "Pangool", p 332-3</ref> Headed by the [[Joof family]].<ref name="Becs"/> |- | Ngolum Joof (var : Ngolum Diouf, proper : Ngolum Juuf) || Nianiane|| Offerings are made at the village of Nianiane (founded by Nokhor Choro Joof<ref name="Pan38"/><ref>Variation : Nokhor Tioro Diouf</ref>) to the ''Ngane'' and [[Adansonia digitata|baobab tree]].<ref name="Pan38"/> Headed by the Joof family<ref name="Becs"/> and the ''Karé-Karé'' matriclan.<ref name="Pangool p 352"/> He is a ''blood Fangool''.<ref name="Pan38"/> |- | Lunguñ Joof (Serer proper : Lunguñ Juuf)<ref>Var : Lungun Diouf</ref>|| FA Oye, Ngouye and [[Tukar]]. || A typical Fangool that delivers justice and have many devotees. Canonized at the time of [[Lamane Jegan Joof]].<ref>Gravrand, "Pangool", pp 342–3, 349</ref> Headed by the Joof family. |- | Ginaaru|| Personal || Personal Fangool of [[Maad a Sinig Maysa Wali Jaxateh Manneh]] (var : Maysa Waaly Dione),<ref name="pan344"/> king of [[Kingdom of Sine|Sine]], reigned : 1350–1370.<ref name="Sarr"/> |- | Njemeh (var : Ndiémé) || Languème || Njemeh is one of the ''milk Pangool''.<ref name="Pan38"/> |- | Moussa Sarr (or : Saar)|| ? || A ''milk Fangool''.<ref name="Pan38"/> |- |Harwak|| Fayil<ref>Gravrand, "Pangool", p 344 & 352</ref> || Veneration headed by the ''Cofaan'' matriclan.<ref name="Pangool p 352"/> |- |Tamba Faye|| Ndiob || According to Serer oral tradition, during the reigne of Maad a Sinig Boukar Tjilas Mahe Soum Joof<ref>Variation : Boukar Tjilas Mahé Soum Diouf</ref> (king of [[Kingdom of Sine|Sine]], [[circa|c]]. 1750 – 1763), the [[Maad a Sinig]] came into conflict with the great Fangool of Ndiob – Tamba Faye.<ref>{{fr}} Diouf, Niokhobaye, "Chronique du royaume du Sine", Suivie de notes sur les traditions orales et les sources écrites concernant le royaume du Sine par Charles Becker et Victor Martin. (1972). Bulletin de l'Ifan, Tome 34, Série B, n° 4, (1972). pp 723 (p 14)</ref> |}
==See also== {{portal|Serer religion|Serer people|Senegal|Gambia|Mauritania|Traditional African religion|Religion}} *[[Nommo]] *[[Snakes in mythology]] *[[Ancestor worship]]
